page.title: 18Thame Recreation-Leisure
page.content: David Rampley and Fergus McVey are two typical 11 year old boys in our area. We asked them to tell us about what they did in their leisure time. They both said that they played computer games. Fergus said that his favourite game was Attic Attack. David is interested in wild life and has made his own bird box in woodwork lessons. They are both keen on sports. They visit the Sports Centre regularly. When they leave school they would like to be engineers. They often make models from a variety of materials. Emma Gardham and Faith Russell use the Sports Centre. They go trampolining and have started to play short tennis. They go to High Wycombe to swim because there is no public pool in Thame. Most of the children like pop music and the favourite group is Duran Duran.
